page.title: 06TRANSPORT IN TURTON
page.content: Two main roads run through the area, the A666 from Bolton to Blackburn, and the A675 from Bolton to Preston. Minor roads to the north of Egerton connect the two, and roads to the south of Egerton provide links with Bromley Cross, Eagley and Harwood, and the railway station. The A666 is very busy, and the 40mph speed limit in Egerton causes much concern. Regular bus services run to Bolton, but only 13% use it regularly, 62% very rarely. Most people travel by car, with 90% of homes having use of a car, 43% more than one. Children travelling to secondary schools are principal users of public transport
